definition: to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture

sentences.english: Tributary states must do as they are told.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們被告知這是附庸國必須要做的。

sentences.english: As a result, the supervisory organs became dependency on the government and powerful ministers came into being.
sentences.chinese: 監察機構成了政府的附庸，爲權臣的產生開闢了道路。

sentences.english: Poland and the Czech Republic were client states of the former USSR for many years.
sentences.chinese: 波蘭和捷克共和國多年來是前蘇聯的附庸國。

sentences.english: And I know I may be an artsy person in sb′s eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我知道可能在別人眼裏我是個附庸風雅的的人。

sentences.english: The whole arty get-up seemed oddly at variance with the way she behaved.
sentences.chinese: 她那套附庸風雅的穿戴似乎跟她的舉止格格不入。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-farty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的電影都是附庸風雅的並且大部分都很長。

sentences.english: China usually treats its client states pretty well.
sentences.chinese: 中國可始終都對附庸國不錯的。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-arty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的電影都是附庸風雅的並且大部分都很長。

sentences.english: I wasn't interested in a snob degree.
sentences.chinese: 我對人家附庸風雅的地位沒有興趣。

sentences.english: Some people have begun to complain that UK has become a salellite country of the US.
sentences.chinese: 已經有抱怨說，英國已成爲美國的附庸國。

sentences.english: They run a little pottery shop and cafe and are very arty -crafty.
sentences.chinese: 他們開了一家小陶器店兼咖啡館，很喜歡附庸風雅。

sentences.english: From a vassal small to independent fiefdoms, qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 從一個附庸小國到獨立的諸侯國，秦。

definition: to adhere/to attach oneself to/to append
counselor of king or feudal warlord/henchman
to vow loyalty and devotion to
